Notes.Text:
This update for cloud-init fixes the following issues:

Update to version 25.1.3 (bsc#1245401,bsc#1245403):

  + docs: provide example3 for PAM and ssh_pwauth behavior (#27)
  + fix: Make hotplug socket writable only by root (#25) (CVE-2024-11584)
  + fix: Don't attempt to identify non-x86 OpenStack instances (LP: #2069607)
    (CVE-2024-6174)

From 25.1.2:

  + fix: ensure MAAS datasource retries on failure (#6167)

Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Vulnerabilities.Description: Sensitive data could be exposed in logs of cloud-init before version 23.1.2. An attacker could use this information to find hashed passwords and possibly escalate their privilege.

cloud-init  through 25.1.2 includes the systemd socket unit  cloud-init-hotplugd.socket with default  SocketMode  that grants 0666 permissions, making it world-writable.  This is used for the "/run/cloud-init/hook-hotplug-cmd" FIFO. An unprivileged user could trigger  hotplug-hook commands.
When a non-x86 platform is detected, cloud-init grants root access to a hardcoded url with a local IP address. To prevent this,  cloud-init default configurations disable platform enumeration.
